result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymon T Hines was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor), Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 2, and any other sentence, with full Huber.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

No contact with victim, unless approved by court or agent, except for third party contact for time with the children.
Court does not object to immediate modification to NON-VIOLENT contact, if victim confirms approval.

Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management based on evaluation.
Parenting classes.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment, if there are positive UA's.
Absolute sobriety.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymon T Hines

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raymon T Hines in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Raymon T Hines in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Court reviewed and returned photographs to the state. Received & Filed, Statement from the victim.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 2, and any other sentence, with credit for 3 DAYS time served, with full Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with full Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 60 DAYS (as to each count) as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, or a course in anger management -based on evaluation. 
-Parenting classes.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment, if there are positive UAs.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim, unless approved by court or agent, except for third party contact for time with the children. Court does no object to immediate modification to NON-VIOLENT contact, if victim confirms approval.
-Obtain/maintain employment, or fulltime school.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Raymon T Hines in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Final Pretrial, parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Amended Information: 
COUNT 1 - Endangering Safety By Use of A Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 941.20(1)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 973.055(1), a class A Misdemeanor.
COUNT 2- Disorderly Conduct, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stat. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 939.63(1)(a), 973.055(1), a class B Misdemeanor.   
Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymon T Hines in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 23.
Final Pretrial held.  Defendant indicated he would like new counsel, but after examination by the Court, he decided to stay with Mr. Harris.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/22/15 in Branch 23.  Parties would like another final pretrial date.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Case spun to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, List of Witnesses, and Motion In Limine.

Defendant Raymon T Hines in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. State's offer is revoked. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS in advance. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Terms of No Contact/No Firearms Order still in effect.

Defendant Raymon T Hines in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Ron Dague for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pleads not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion For Reduction Of Bail, Filed By Thomas E. Harris
Notice Of Motion, Filed By Thomas E. Harris

15RM006414  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-06-2015

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TANISHA D. (THE ONLY EXCEPTION BEING THIRD PARTY CONTACT THROUGH THE DEFENDANT'S MOTHER REGARDING CARE OF CHILDREN.)
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Raymon T Hines in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Raymon T Hines in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE FOR BRANCH 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
